uniqueRequirements: Test is strictly divided: 20 Road Signs and 20 Road Rules
Must score 75% (15/20) on EACH section independently to pass; failing one section fails the entire exam
Joshua's Law (30 hours class + 6 hours drive) is required to upgrade to a Class D license at age 16, not to get the permit at 15
New 2025 Law: 'Squatted' trucks (front fender raised 4+ inches higher than rear) are prohibited on public roads
New 2025 Law: Spectators at street racing events can now face criminal misdemeanor charges

questions.questionText: Under the 'Hands-Free Georgia Act', drivers are prohibited from:

answers.text: Holding a phone with any part of their body

questions.explanation: Drivers cannot physically hold or support a wireless device with any part of their body. They may use earpieces or Bluetooth for calls if the device is not held.

questions.questionText: Georgia's 'Super Speeder' law defines a Super Speeder as a driver convicted of speeding at ___ or more on any two-lane road, or ___ or more on any highway.
questions.explanation: A Super Speeder is defined as driving 75 mph or more on a two-lane road or 85 mph or more on any road/highway. This incurs an additional $200 state fee.

questions.questionText: The 'Move Over' Law requires drivers to:

answers.text: Move to the next lane if safe when approaching emergency or utility vehicles with flashing lights
Speed up to pass the scene quickly

questions.explanation: Drivers must move over one lane when approaching stationary emergency, towing, or utility vehicles. If unable to move over, they must slow down below the speed limit.

questions.questionText: Drivers under the age of 21 are considered DUI if their Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) is:
questions.explanation: Georgia has a Zero Tolerance policy for drivers under 21. A BAC of 0.02% or higher constitutes a DUI offense.

questions.questionText: When a school bus stops to load or unload children on a highway divided by a dirt median or grass strip:

answers.text: Traffic in both directions must stop
Only traffic following the bus must stop
Traffic on the opposite side can proceed with caution

questions.explanation: If the highway is divided by a dirt, grass, or concrete median, traffic approaching from the opposite direction is not required to stop.

questions.questionText: If you drive off the pavement:

answers.text: Jerk the steering wheel back towards the road immediately
Take your foot off the gas and brake gently
Accelerate to get back on the road

questions.explanation: Do not jerk the wheel. Ease off the gas, brake gently, and steer back onto the pavement when speed is reduced and it is safe.

questions.questionText: Driving without insurance in Georgia is:

answers.text: Allowed if you pay a fee

questions.explanation: Driving without liability insurance is a misdemeanor and can result in license suspension and fines.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit on a rural interstate is:
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on rural interstates in Georgia is 70 mph.

questions.questionText: A Class D (Provisional) license holder may not drive between the hours of:
questions.explanation: Class D license holders (ages 16-17) are prohibited from driving between 12:00 midnight and 5:00 AM, with no exceptions.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangle sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangular signs are generally regulatory signs that inform you of traffic laws.

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with an X and RR means:
questions.explanation: The round yellow sign is the advance warning for a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: An orange diamond-shaped sign means:
questions.explanation: Orange signs warn of construction or maintenance zones. Fines may be doubled in these areas.

questions.questionText: A pentagon (5-sided) sign means:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is reserved for school zones and crossings.

questions.questionText: When entering a highway from a driveway, you must:

answers.text: Yield to all vehicles and pedestrians

questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to all vehicles and pedestrians on the main roadway.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Parking is illegal within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

questions.questionText: According to Joshua's Law, teenagers must complete ___ hours of classroom instruction before getting a license.
questions.explanation: Joshua's Law requires 16-year-olds to complete 30 hours of approved driver education to obtain a Class D license.

questions.questionText: When driving behind another vehicle at night, you should:

answers.text: Keep your headlights on low beam

questions.explanation: Use low beams when following another vehicle within 200 feet to avoid blinding the driver.

questions.questionText: The maximum speed limit in an urban or residential district is usually:
questions.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in an urban or residential district is 30 mph.

questions.questionText: If two vehicles arrive at a 4-way stop at the same time:

answers.text: The vehicle on the left yields to the vehicle on the right
The vehicle on the right yields to the vehicle on the left
The driver who signals first goes

questions.explanation: At a 4-way stop, if vehicles arrive simultaneously, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

questions.questionText: During the first 6 months of holding a Class D license, you may drive with:
questions.explanation: For the first 6 months, only immediate family members may ride in the vehicle with a Class D driver.

questions.questionText: Hydroplaning can occur when driving:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs on wet roads when tires lose contact with the road surface and ride on a film of water.

questions.questionText: In Georgia, headlights must be turned on:

answers.text: 30 minutes after sunset to 30 minutes before sunrise

questions.explanation: Headlights are required from 30 minutes after sunset to 30 minutes before sunrise, or anytime visibility is limited.

questions.questionText: When sharing the road with a bicycle, you must allow at least ___ of space between your vehicle and the bicycle.
questions.explanation: Georgia law requires drivers to leave at least 3 feet of safe distance when passing a bicycle.

questions.questionText: A red circle with a line through it means:
questions.explanation: This is the universal symbol for 'No'. The action pictured inside is prohibited.

questions.questionText: To maintain a safe following distance, Georgia recommends using the:
questions.explanation: The 2-second rule is the minimum recommended following distance on dry roads.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped yellow sign usually warns of:
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond signs are general warning signs indicating hazards like curves, intersections, or slippery roads.

questions.questionText: Double solid yellow lines in the center of the road mean:

answers.text: Passing is prohibited in both directions
Passing allowed only on the right

questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines indicate that passing is not allowed for vehicles traveling in either direction.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in an accident, you are required to:

answers.text: Drive home and call the police

questions.explanation: You must stop immediately, render aid if needed, and exchange information with other drivers.

questions.questionText: An octagon-shaped sign is always a:
questions.explanation: The octagon is exclusively used for STOP signs.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians have the right-of-way:

answers.text: Only when the light is green
In all crosswalks, whether marked or unmarked

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in any crosswalk.

questions.questionText: The 'Gore' is:

answers.text: The area of convergence between two lanes of traffic

questions.explanation: The 'Gore' is the triangular area between the highway and an exit/entrance ramp. Driving in this area is prohibited.

questions.questionText: Drivers in the left lane of a multi-lane highway must move right if:

answers.text: They are driving below the speed limit
Faster traffic is approaching from behind
They are not passing another vehicle

questions.explanation: Slower traffic must keep right. The left lane is primarily for passing.

questions.questionText: Which lights should you use when driving in fog?
questions.explanation: High beams reflect off fog and cause glare. Use low beams for better visibility.

questions.questionText: A triangular sign pointing downward is a:
questions.explanation: The inverted triangle indicates you must yield the right-of-way.

questions.questionText: Littering in Georgia is punishable by:

answers.text: A fine up to $1000 and points on your license

questions.explanation: Littering is a serious offense in GA, carrying fines up to $1,000 and potential points on your driving record.

questions.questionText: You must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights unless:

answers.text: You are on the opposite side of a separated roadway with a median

questions.explanation: You are only exempt from stopping if you are on the opposite side of a divided highway separated by a physical median.

questions.questionText: When making a left turn at an intersection:

answers.text: You have the right of way
You must yield to oncoming traffic
Oncoming traffic must stop for you

questions.explanation: Left-turning vehicles must yield to oncoming traffic going straight.

questions.questionText: If your brakes fail while driving:

answers.text: Shift to a lower gear and pump the brakes

questions.explanation: Shift to a lower gear to use engine braking and pump the brake pedal to build pressure.

questions.questionText: Blue signs typically indicate:
questions.explanation: Blue signs are used for motorist services.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to flash your turn signal:

answers.text: As a courtesy or 'do it pass' signal to other drivers

questions.explanation: It is illegal to use your turn signals to tell other drivers it is safe to pass.

questions.questionText: Effective July 1, 2025, vehicle suspension modifications ('Squatted Trucks') are prohibited if:

answers.text: The front fender is raised 4 or more inches higher than the rear fender
The vehicle is lifted evenly more than 2 inches
The tires are larger than 35 inches

questions.explanation: New laws prohibit vehicles where the front frame is more than 4 inches higher than the rear frame, often called a 'Carolina Squat'.

questions.questionText: New penalties for street racing and reckless driving include:

answers.text: Vehicle impoundment for up to 30 days after a second offense

questions.explanation: Stricter laws allow for vehicle impoundment and felony charges for repeat street racing offenders.

questions.questionText: If you are under 21 and convicted of street racing, your license will be:
questions.explanation: Street racing convictions can lead to immediate license revocation and high fines.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer symbol means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates that deer may cross the road in this area.

questions.questionText: Drivers turning left must yield to:
questions.explanation: Left-turning drivers must always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians in the crosswalk.

questions.questionText: A white sign with a curved arrow and the word 'ONLY' means:

answers.text: You must turn in the direction of the arrow

questions.explanation: Regulatory signs with 'ONLY' dictate mandatory lane usage.

questions.questionText: If you are being tailgated, you should:

answers.text: Move to the right lane and let them pass
Turn on your rear fog lights

questions.explanation: The safest action is to change lanes and allow the tailgater to pass.

questions.questionText: You may pass on the right when:

answers.text: The vehicle ahead is making a left turn and there is room on the pavement

questions.explanation: Passing on the right is allowed if the vehicle is turning left or on multi-lane roads, but never off the pavement.

questions.questionText: Refusing a chemical test for DUI in Georgia results in:
questions.explanation: Implied Consent laws mean refusal leads to a 1-year suspension.

questions.questionText: A sign with a truck going down a hill means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a steep hill ahead where trucks may speed up.

questions.questionText: When checking your blind spot, you should:

answers.text: Turn your head and look over your shoulder

questions.explanation: Mirrors leave blind spots; you must physically check by turning your head.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a cross (+) symbol means:
questions.explanation: A cross symbol warns of an upcoming intersection.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a school zone is usually:
questions.explanation: School zones typically have reduced speeds like 25 mph during school hours.

questions.questionText: If your car begins to skid:

answers.text: Ease off the gas and steer in the direction of the skid
Turn the wheel opposite the skid

questions.explanation: Take your foot off the gas and turn into the skid (where the rear is going).

questions.questionText: You must always stop when:

answers.text: A police officer directs you to

questions.explanation: Orders from police or flaggers overrule traffic signs and signals.

questions.questionText: A sign with two arrows pointing in opposite directions with a divider at the top means:
questions.explanation: If the divider is at the top, the divided highway is ending.

questions.questionText: Accumulating 15 points in a 24-month period will result in:
questions.explanation: Georgia suspends licenses for 15 points within 24 months.

questions.questionText: When parking uphill with a curb, you should turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels away from the curb so if it rolls back, the tire hits the curb.

questions.questionText: To avoid highway hypnosis, you should:

answers.text: Take breaks every 2 hours or 100 miles

questions.explanation: Regular stops help maintain alertness on long drives.

questions.questionText: A yellow pennant-shaped sign on the left side of the road indicates:
questions.explanation: The pennant shape marks the start of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use a center turn lane for:
questions.explanation: Center turn lanes are for turning only, not for passing.

questions.questionText: Unless turning, you should stay out of the 'No-Zone', which refers to:
questions.explanation: No-Zones are the large blind spots around commercial trucks.

questions.questionText: A flashing red traffic light means:

answers.text: Stop completely, then proceed when safe

questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red light exactly like a stop sign.

questions.questionText: You may turn right on red if:

answers.text: You stop first and there is no sign prohibiting it

questions.explanation: Right on red is legal after a full stop, unless signage says otherwise.

questions.questionText: A sign with a T-intersection symbol means:

answers.text: The road ends ahead, must turn left or right

questions.explanation: Warns that the road terminates at the intersection.

questions.questionText: When approaching a stopped emergency vehicle on the shoulder:

answers.text: Move over a lane or slow down
Stay in your lane at speed

questions.explanation: Move Over Law requires changing lanes or slowing down.

questions.questionText: When entering an expressway, use the acceleration lane to:

answers.text: Speed up to match traffic flow

questions.explanation: Use the lane to reach highway speed for safe merging.

questions.questionText: Bicyclists on the road:

answers.text: Have the same rights and duties as drivers

questions.explanation: Bicycles are vehicles and must obey traffic laws.

questions.questionText: A brown sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Brown signs point to parks, historic sites, and recreation.

questions.questionText: High beam headlights should be dimmed within ___ feet of an approaching vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams 500 feet before meeting a vehicle.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out:

answers.text: Grip the wheel firmly and slow down gradually

questions.explanation: Do not brake instantly; maintain control and coast to a stop.

questions.questionText: Unless posted, the speed limit in a business district is:
questions.explanation: Business/residential limit is 30 mph in GA.

questions.questionText: A solid yellow line on your side of the road means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow line indicates a no-passing zone.

questions.questionText: A sign with a wheelchair symbol indicates:
questions.explanation: Reserved parking for disabled permits only.

questions.questionText: You must stop at a railroad crossing when:

answers.text: Lights are flashing or a gate is down

questions.explanation: Stop for signals, gates, trains, or flaggers.

questions.questionText: When driving in rain, you must:
questions.explanation: Wipers on requires headlights on in GA.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit on an expressway:
questions.explanation: Never back up on an expressway. Proceed to the next exit.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a sharp turn arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warning for a sharp curve or turn.

questions.questionText: At an intersection with no signs or signals, yield to:
questions.explanation: Yield to the vehicle on the right at uncontrolled intersections.

questions.questionText: Seat belts are required for:

answers.text: Drivers and front seat passengers, and minors

questions.explanation: GA requires belts for front seat occupants and all minors.

questions.questionText: Effective July 1, 2025, operating a drone over a ticketed event is:
questions.explanation: New law prohibits drones within 400 feet of ticketed events.

questions.questionText: Automated traffic enforcement cameras in school zones are authorized to:
questions.explanation: Cameras can enforce speed limits in school zones.

questions.questionText: Transferring a pet at a roadside or public park is:
questions.explanation: New law bans transferring pets at roadsides/parks.

questions.questionText: Using a fake ID to buy alcohol will result in:
questions.explanation: Using false ID leads to license suspension.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a signal light picture means:
questions.explanation: Warning for an upcoming traffic light.

questions.questionText: When checking mirrors, you should also:

answers.text: Turn your head to check blind spots

questions.explanation: Head checks clear blind spots.

questions.questionText: You may turn right on red if:

answers.text: You stop and it is safe, unless prohibited

questions.explanation: Right on red is legal after stopping.

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow light means:

answers.text: Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.explanation: Proceed with caution at flashing yellow.

questions.questionText: If you refuse a state-administered chemical test for DUI:

answers.text: Your license will be suspended for 1 year

questions.explanation: Refusal results in a 1-year suspension.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Keep Right' and an arrow means:

answers.text: Stay to the right of the divider

questions.explanation: Drive to the right of the obstruction.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle starts to skid:

answers.text: Take your foot off the gas and steer in direction of skid

questions.explanation: Ease off gas and steer into skid.

questions.questionText: You must signal at least ___ feet before turning.
questions.explanation: Signal 100 feet in advance.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: Do not park within 50 feet of tracks.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a truck rollover symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warns of rollover risk for trucks.

questions.questionText: Unless posted, the speed limit on an unpaved county road is:
questions.explanation: Unpaved road limit is 35 mph.

questions.questionText: To avoid being blinded by oncoming high beams:

answers.text: Look to the right edge of the road

questions.explanation: Look to the right side line to maintain lane position.

questions.questionText: You cannot pass on a two-lane road if:

answers.text: You are within 100 feet of a bridge or tunnel

questions.explanation: Passing prohibited near bridges/tunnels.

questions.questionText: Motorcycles are entitled to:
questions.explanation: Motorcycles have right to full lane.

questions.questionText: A sign indicating 'Lane Ends' means:
questions.explanation: Merge as the lane is ending.

questions.questionText: Georgia's 'Slowpoke Law' requires drivers in the left lane to:

answers.text: Move right if faster traffic approaches

questions.explanation: Slower traffic must move right to allow passing.

questions.questionText: Large trucks have blind spots called:
questions.explanation: Truck blind spots are No-Zones.

questions.questionText: You must yield to funeral processions:
questions.explanation: Yield to vehicles in funeral processions.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a T-intersection symbol means:

answers.text: Road ends ahead, turn left or right

questions.explanation: T-intersection warning.

questions.questionText: Wearing headphones in both ears while driving is:
questions.explanation: Headphones in both ears are prohibited.

questions.questionText: You may cross a double yellow line to:
questions.explanation: You can cross double yellow to turn into a driveway/alley.

questions.questionText: When passing a large truck, do not:
questions.explanation: Pass quickly; don't hang in the No-Zone.

questions.questionText: If you hit a parked car and cannot find the owner:

answers.text: Leave a note with your info

questions.explanation: Leave note with contact details securely attached.

questions.questionText: A sign saying 'Slippery When Wet' is:
questions.explanation: Warning sign for slippery conditions.

questions.questionText: You must dim high beams when following within:
questions.explanation: Dim lights 200 feet when following.

questions.questionText: A solid white line between lanes means:
questions.explanation: Solid white means changing lanes is discouraged/prohibited.

questions.questionText: The legal BAC limit for drivers over 21 is:
questions.explanation: 0.08% is the DUI threshold for adults.

questions.questionText: When passing a cyclist, allow at least:
questions.explanation: 3 feet clearance required for bikes.

questions.questionText: If your car stalls on railroad tracks:

answers.text: Get out and run towards the train at an angle

questions.explanation: Run toward train (45-degree angle) to avoid debris.

questions.questionText: A sign with two people walking means:
questions.explanation: Pentagon with figures indicates school zone.

questions.questionText: You may turn left on red if:
questions.explanation: Left on red allowed only one-way to one-way.

questions.questionText: Coasting downhill in neutral is:
questions.explanation: Coasting is unsafe and illegal.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out:
questions.explanation: Maintain control, do not brake abruptly.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a winding arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warning for winding road ahead.

questions.questionText: Parking is illegal within ___ feet of a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: No parking within 20 feet of crosswalk.

questions.questionText: High Occupancy Vehicle (HOV) lanes are marked by:
questions.explanation: Diamond symbol marks HOV lanes.

questions.questionText: When entering a tunnel:
questions.explanation: Turn on lights for visibility.

questions.questionText: If you refuse a chemical test for the second time in 5 years:
questions.explanation: Second refusal leads to 3-year suspension.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a Plus (+) means:
questions.explanation: Warning for an intersection.

questions.questionText: You must signal before turning for at least:
questions.explanation: Signal turn 100 feet in advance.

questions.questionText: Texting while driving is:
questions.explanation: Hands-Free Act bans texting for everyone.

questions.questionText: If you drive through deep water, you should:
questions.explanation: Test brakes after water exposure.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a stop sign.
questions.explanation: No parking within 30 feet of stop signs.

questions.questionText: A sign saying 'Keep Right' means:

answers.text: Drive to the right of the obstruction

questions.explanation: Keep to the right of the divider.

questions.questionText: Drivers turning left on a green light must:
questions.explanation: Left turn yield on green.

questions.questionText: If you are under 18, you cannot drive between:
questions.explanation: Joshua's Law curfew is midnight to 5 AM.

questions.questionText: A fluorescent pink sign means:
questions.explanation: Pink signs denote emergency incidents.

questions.questionText: To avoid blind spots, do not drive:

answers.text: In the rear quarter of other cars

questions.explanation: Avoid lurking in blind spots.

questions.questionText: You must dim high beams when following another vehicle within:
questions.explanation: Dim lights 200 feet when following.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a side road symbol (T on side) means:
questions.explanation: Warning for side road intersection.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to back up:
questions.explanation: Backing on highways is illegal.

questions.questionText: If you are drowsy while driving:
questions.explanation: Rest is the only cure for drowsiness.

questions.questionText: A solid white line on the right edge of the road is:
questions.explanation: Fog line marks the road edge.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Dip' means:
questions.explanation: Warning for a dip in the road.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a flashing red light. You should:
questions.explanation: Flashing red equals stop sign.

questions.questionText: When checking your blind spot, turn your head:
questions.explanation: Quick head check to clear blind spot.

questions.questionText: Under new 2025 laws, street racing can result in:
questions.explanation: Repeat street racing is now a felony.

questions.questionText: You must obey traffic officers:
questions.explanation: Officers overrule all signals.

questions.questionText: If your accelerator sticks:
questions.explanation: Neutral allows you to stop safely.

questions.questionText: A green arrow means:
questions.explanation: Protected turn in direction of arrow.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb:
questions.explanation: Wheels toward curb to roll into it.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Soft Shoulder' means:
questions.explanation: Do not drive on the soft shoulder.

questions.questionText: New 2025 vehicle height laws target:

answers.text: Squatted trucks with front lifted higher than rear

questions.explanation: Ban on trucks with front >4 inches higher than rear.

questions.questionText: To enter a roundabout:
questions.explanation: Yield to traffic already in circle.

questions.questionText: Unless posted, the speed limit on a multi-lane highway is:
questions.explanation: Standard limit is 55 mph.

questions.questionText: A circular sign tells you:
questions.explanation: Circle always means railroad warning.
